title: error msg after trying to log out
content:
Hi, Today I have spent a lot of time on Mozilla trying to find solutions. On logging out of any of my Amazon accounts (including KDP) I get an error on the page saying error I cannot log out of any site on Amazon. This is the first time I have encountered a problem. I have tried resetting my password, which was a disaster. Mozilla, when I enter the new password, it does not recognize the current password until I try again. Then it recognizes the password as old and not new. It is a shambles. I have been locked out twice and still have no solution and now I have 2 problems and not just one.

I did a bit of research but the information was outdated (2015) about such a problem previously.
creator: runawayprincesses

My website is based on Premium Asset Recover Tools And Services. and my services pages that are not opening are of bitcoin recovery tools and private key finder. Any help would be appreciated. title: Firefox browser home page
content: 12.7.22 I've recently upgraded to OS12 on mac. Browsers now also updated. Some minor differences in interfaces. Something buggy about Firefox initial opening page shows boxes with History visited sites logos for quick reference to sign in to various pre-visited sites. These have always appeared even on previous versions. However on this latest version, the container box for the site logos is same but the logos within the boxes is much smaller. Like floating in the boxes. Must be some way to solve this making the site logos larger within container boxes. Screenshot of current problem. Unfortunately don't have one of last FF version I think v78.?.? thanks Larry
creator: fives

title: Firefox hangs constantly lately on my iPad
content: I have been using Firefox as my browser of choice on my Mac desktop, iPhone SE, and iPad for years. It has always worked beautifully. But in the past couple of weeks, it hangs constantly on my iPad. (My iPad is relatively new, about two years old.) Firefox still works great on my desktop and iPhone. I’m not doing anything differently on my iPad and can’t figure out why it’s hanging so much. I don’t notice this problem with any other app. I tried clearing my cache and browsing history. I tried removing Firefox from my iPad and then reloading it. Nothing I’ve tried works. When I’ve Googled the problem, the directions I get for things to try read as though they’re written for a programmer. I sure don’t understand them. I don’t want to have to use a different browser on my iPad, but if the problem persists, then I probably will have no other choice. This is exasperating.
creator: gregtodd8

title: Firefox not displaying images uploaded to WordPress
content:
I logged into my website using Firefox, 3 days ago and blamed the server for not allowing the images to appear in the Media Library properly. It took several attempts before the images would appear properly.

Today, when trying to upload a tiny 43KB image, the same issue happened, and again I blamed the hosting server.

However, I have tried uploading the same image to 5 different websites, using Firefox and the SAME thing happens. This time, it doesn't matter how many times I upload and delete the same image. It simply refuses to be displayed.

Back to the site I want the image uploaded in, and I used the Opera browser... POOF! Image uploads FINE and displays PERFECTLY in Opera, as well as AFTER logging out. Checking with the Brave browser, yes, it too sees the image... but when I try viewing the page in Firefox, the browser REFUSES to load the image.

I've tried 2 different computers using 2 different IP addresses, and an Android device, using Firefox and NOPE, the image REFUSES to load.

What is going on... am I the ONLY one experiencing this issue?

I've cleared cookies, I've rebooted my working computer... I've exhausted EVERY attempt at my end in trying to figure this out.

Can ANYONE shed some light on this issue please? I have many visitors to all of my sites that use Firefox, so this HAS to be resolved a.s.a.p.

Thank you in advance, Trish
creator: trish.parr

title: slashdot.org loads slowly due to a.fsdn.com or DoH ?
content:
During an initial visit to slashdot.org Firefox hangs for approx 45 seconds while the status bar says "looked up a.fsdn.com." Subsequent visits during the same browser session load promptly.

This is with Preferences -> General -> Network Settings -> Enable DNS over HTTPS -> Cloudfare or NextDNS. With Firefox DoH disabled the problem is not present. [Interesting side, the machine's systemwide DNS settings are configured for Cloudfare 1.1.1.1 ]

AFAIK all other sites load normally. I've been using the Firefox DOH for several months with only the above site as a problem.

Ideas?

Environment: Firefox desktop 106.x and 107.x macOS 10.13.6 The problem is present in "Troubleshoot Mode" when Firefox DOH is enabled.
creator: timothybright

title: Tabs constantly crashing
content:
For the past few weeks Firefox is constantly crashing on me - mostly tabs, but sometimes the whole app. There doesn't seem to be a particular site it crashes on - sometimes video, sometimes twitter, sometimes just WaPo.

I've tried safe mode, I've refreshed the browser, I've even removed the data folder+deleted the app and reinstalled. Nothing helps. Looking for any insights before I'm forced over to Chrome?
